title: NASA reshuffles commercial crew astronaut assignments because of Starliner delays
summary: NASA has reassigned two astronauts from Boeing commercial crew missions to a SpaceX one as the agency addresses delays in the development of the CST-100 Starliner and works out a seat barter agreement with Russia.

title: NASA swaps two astronauts from Boeing missions to SpaceX crew flight
summary: NASA has reassigned two rookie astronauts from missions on Boeing’s troubled Starliner crew capsule to a SpaceX crew mission to the International Space Station late next year, a move agency officials said will allow the astronauts to gain spaceflight experience for future lunar expeditions.

title: Roscosmos selects first cosmonaut for commercial crew flights
summary: The head of Roscosmos announced Dec. 8 that the agency has selected the first cosmonaut to go on a SpaceX commercial crew mission to the International Space Station, although a seat barter agreement between NASA and Roscosmos is still being finalized.

title: SpaceX swapping heat shield for next crew flight due to ‘manufacturing defect’
summary: SpaceX’s next crew mission to the International Space Station, set for launch in September, will fly with a different heat shield structure than originally planned after the Dragon spacecraft’s composite substrate failed during acceptance testing, NASA said Tuesday.

title: SpaceX replacing heat shield on upcoming Crew Dragon mission after failed test
summary: SpaceX will replace the heat shield on the next Crew Dragon spacecraft flying to the International Space Station after it failed inspections, but NASA says there is no risk of a similar problem for the spacecraft currently at the station.

title: NASA still “pushing” for a Russian cosmonaut to fly on next SpaceX mission
summary: "I think it's the right thing to do."

title: Crew Dragon mission delayed after booster damaged in transport
summary: NASA is delaying the next commercial crew mission to the International Space Station by nearly a month after the Falcon 9 booster that will launch it was damaged during transport across the country for testing.

title: Rocket Report: A heavy-lift rocket funded by crypto; Falcon 9 damaged in transport
summary: "EcoRocket Heavy is an ecological, reusable, unprecedentedly low-cost rocket."

title: SpaceX’s next crew launch delayed by booster damage
summary: SpaceX and NASA have delayed the launch of the next U.S. crew flight to the International Space Station from early September to no earlier than Sept. 29, allowing time for ground teams to replace an interstage on the mission’s new Falcon 9 booster after it was damaged during transport.

title: NASA to Host Briefings, Interviews for Agency’s SpaceX Crew-5 Mission
summary: A pair of news conferences on Thursday, Aug. 4, at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston will highlight the agency’s SpaceX Crew-5 mission to the International Space Station.

title: SpaceX, NASA announce date for next Crew Dragon astronaut launch
summary: SpaceX and NASA have settled on October 3rd for the company’s fifth operational astronaut launch, a mission that will also mark the...

title: SpaceX and NASA in final preparations for Crew-5 mission
summary: With the launch just weeks away, SpaceX, NASA, and their international partners are in final preparations for the fifth operational Crew Dragon mission. As part of NASA’s Commercial Crew Program (CCP), Crew-5 will be SpaceX’s fifth long-duration crew mission, eighth overall crewed mission, and the first mission with a Russian Cosmonaut.

title: NASA to Cover Crew Arrival to Launch Site, Flight Readiness Review
summary: NASA will host two media briefings Monday, Sept. 26, in preparation for the fifth crew rotation mission with SpaceX as part of the agency’s Commercial Crew Program.

title: Crew-5 launch preparations continue amid hurricane threat
summary: NASA is, for now, moving ahead with plans for a launch of the next crew to the International Space Station early next week as it watches an approaching hurricane.

title: SpaceX, ULA postpone launches as Hurricane Ian moves toward Florida
summary: The forecast track of Hurricane Ian across Central Florida has forced SpaceX and United Launch Alliance to postpone several launches planned in the coming days at Cape Canaveral, including the next crew flight to the International Space Station, a Starlink mission, and the liftoff of an Atlas 5 rocket.

title: Florida’s Space Coast on track after Ian, set for 3 launches in 3 days
summary: Managers will assess the scope of work to perform while in the VAB.

title: Coverage Set for NASA’s SpaceX Crew-5 Events, Broadcast, Launch
summary: NASA will provide coverage of the upcoming prelaunch and launch activities for the agency’s SpaceX Crew-5 mission with astronauts to the International Space Station.

title: Preps resume for SpaceX crew launch after Hurricane Ian
summary: The multinational crew scheduled to ride a SpaceX rocket into orbit Wednesday arrived at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center Saturday as ground teams rolled their Falcon 9 booster and Dragon Endurance spacecraft to the launch pad, resuming work suspended earlier in the week as Hurricane Ian moved across Florida.

title: Crew dress rehearsal, rocket test-firing complete at SpaceX launch pad
summary: SpaceX teams and the four crew members set for blastoff this week to the International Space Station completed dress rehearsals Sunday at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida, familiarizing the astronauts with their launch day checklist and testing out the Falcon 9 rocket that will carry them into orbit.

title: SpaceX targeting three launches from three pads in 31 hours
summary: Update: SpaceX says it and NASA are moving forward with plans to launch a Crew Dragon carrying US, Japanese, and Russian astronauts...

title: SpaceX crew mission ‘top priority’ amid busy week of Falcon 9 launches
summary: SpaceX’s next astronaut launch for NASA, set for Wednesday from Kennedy Space Center, is one of three missions on the company’s schedule this week from launch pads in Florida and California. The crew mission will get top priority, a SpaceX official said, as managers watch downrange sea conditions and technicians try to resolve final technical issues before liftoff.
